differences.gitbook:
The October update will cover:
- Recap of Github training session, and share Colleen's slides
- Announce the shift to Biweekly meetings 
- Announce the two upcoming skills training sessions (M&E; decentralized governance)
- Re-share the Onboarding journeys infographics, plus a doc where people can add their own input on barriers they have faced
differences.supabase:
- Recap of Github session with the slides
- Announcing the shift to Biweekly meetings 
- Announce the upcoming skills training session (M&E session and Onboarding to decentralized governance)
- Share the Onboarding journeys infographics

differences.gitbook: Town hall update: Duke to give the townhall updates at the end of the month.
differences.supabase: Town hall update: Duke to give the townhall updates at the end of the month

differences.gitbook: Onboarding Journeys: Onize agreed to publicize the infographics created by Duke, Love and Cjfrankie in the ambassador-general Discord channel and other relevant channels. She will also create a survey for people to give info on their own onboarding experiences (see https://forms.gle/VcQVJAoXtYa1ukB77).
differences.supabase: Onboarding Journey: Onize agreed to publicize the infographics created by Duke and Cjfrankie in the ambassador general and some relevant channels.

differences.gitbook: Skillshare matrix: LadyTempestt noted that the Skillshare Matrix might be somewhat redundant now, as the workgroup is currently closed, so all existing members have already added to it, and any new people would be adding their skills without being able to get paid tasks in which to use them. Vani suggested we could get further use out of the skillshare matrix by sharing it with the rest of the Program, perhaps in collaboration with R&D's collaboration skills database project - we might be able to add useful input on classifying and better representing non-tech skills, as we've done quite a lot of work on that in our skillshare matrix, and the R&D approach has tended to prioritise tech skills. Then LordKizzy spoke on R&D's Collaboration Skills Database project and its possible collaborations with the Onboarding workgroup. He suggested gathering skills of members through the R&D Guild project rather than having two initiatives that serve the same purpose. We agreed to discuss further next meeting.
differences.supabase: Skillshare matrix: Love Owokere suggested that the Skills Matrix is currently ineffective for new members, as they cannot perform tasks without tag and the workgroup is currently closed for them to get one. Vani proposed that the Skills Matrix should be shared to other workgroups, including in the ambassador program, to help members, especially new ones, better understand their skill requirements and development pathways, then LordKizzy spoke on the R&D Guildâ€™s Collaboration Skills Database project and its possible collaborations with the Onboarding workgroup. He emphasized on gathering the skills of members within the program through the R&D Guild project rather than having two initiatives that serve the same purpose.

differences.gitbook: Onboarding to decentralization research project: Ayo shared a planning doc created by him and Kateri (see https://docs.google.com/document/d/14erz8t4HKPtql7BB9dK6bKLZ-2KFxay76YWrqgmBfRI/edit?usp=sharing) to outline possible questions, and we discussed. Couple of suggestions were made for minor changes, but generally, the group approved it. Ayo and Kateri will come back next meeting to outline a research strategy or approach.
differences.supabase: Onboarding to decentralization: Ayo discussed the aim of study on how people transition into and adapt to a decentralized work environment. Specifically, it aims to understand previous experiences, support and resources, adaptation process, the challenges and the benefits, the perceptions of decentralization.Also to note that since the workgroup is closed, it is not possible to get the tag back if taken from.

differences.gitbook: It was decided during the meeting that the recording of the GitHub training should not be timestamped or shared
differences.supabase: Onize suggested promoting the onboarding journeys by visiting various workgroup meetings, while the group collectively decided against sharing onboarding challenges on public platforms, opting for internal communication instead.

differences.gitbook: Colleen was absent and Vani had to step in to host the session without adequate preparation, so it might not be that useful; also, LordKizzy has already produced a GitHub walkthru video for Archives WG - see https://youtu.be/abaUWUBOU28?si=PyR0CRq9CLC2e3Na
Duke to facilitate next meeting and MartinSoki to document
